bug.author: prabindh
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
Please provide a link to the documentation entry, for example: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/nn/softmax>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/nn/softmax</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
Yes <denchmark-h:h3>Correct links</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-h:h3>Parameters defined</denchmark-h>
No. Per the code, the first argument "logits" can be of any type that can be passed to "convert_to_tensor()", not just a tensor. Therefore the documentation can be modified to include "Tensor objects, numpy arrays, Python lists, and Python scalars". <denchmark-h:h3>Returns defined</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-h:h3>Raises listed and defined</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
yes

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/prabindh>@prabindh</denchmark-link> , As the PR associated with the issue is merged, can we proceed for the closure ?Thanks!
